Reviews.Title: Excellent Product
Reviews.Author: G. Sharma
Reviews.Content: One of the best LCDs for the price. The menus are easy to navigate. After some customization the picture is perfect. Really like the deep black that the TV delivers. Colors are crisp. Well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: Bravia 52" Sony
Reviews.Author: mickey moe
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the service and delivery of the Sony TV. I would definitely recommend Amazon.  This is the second Sony Bravia wepurchased from Amazon and would do it again.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Brent
Reviews.Content: Great TV, the picture looks great, the sound is better than other televisions.  The Sony was chosen over the Samsung because the Samsung has more of a glare in lighter conditions. Amazon had good service, but its yo-yo pricing on this TV is interesting.  I first looked at this TV when the pricing was around 1800.  I bought it for 1650, then price went down to 1595 before I received the TV, I called Amazon and they matched the lower price, but it was only at this lower price for a day, then it went back into the 1600's, then it went up to 1900 now it is at 2000.  This is all within a months time. I haven't checked the price every day, but I am sure it has changed even more then I indicated.  I'm developing a hobby of checking the price since it is fun to see what the price will be on a given day.

Reviews.Title: SONY GREAT PURCHASE
Reviews.Author: Daniel J. Kummer
Reviews.Content: I bought this LCD from warehousedeals.com....I didn't know Amazon had a warehouse.  Best price anywhere.  Perfect delivery in a amazon box.  the Pilot delivery men unwrapped it in my living room.  Technically the set is perfect.  Great purchase.  I looked at Vizio 55 and Sharp 52 with 120 hz, but the Sony was the winner because of the price I received at Amazon warehouse.

Reviews.Title: SONY 52W4100
Reviews.Author: Sailorborne
Reviews.Content: Outstanding product.  I was hesitant to make such a large purchase online, but couldn't be any happier.  I also purchased the Sony Blu Ray which and linked it up with the TV and a Sony surround souund.  It's not the best of the best out there, but for the price and quality, there's nothing comparable.

Reviews.Title: great picture, great sound
Reviews.Author: Eric
Reviews.Content: It's almost been a month and so far, so great!  Have always had good experience with sony products (knock on wood).  My first LCD tv was a 40 inch of the older W series and all is still good after more than a year.  This one exhibits great picture and great sound...the 120hz refresh rate does make a difference.  Great price with Amazon too.  I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Sony Bravia
Reviews.Author: Ngburg "NewGrad09"
Reviews.Content: We love our new Sony Bravia.  Great picture quality and sound, easy to set-up and use. Product delivered without any problems.

Reviews.Title: Sony TV
Reviews.Author: W. Jansen
Reviews.Content: Simply the best price around.  Awesome deal.  The TV's not too bad either.  :-)

Reviews.Title: Watching TV all the time now!
Reviews.Author: Daphne H
Reviews.Content: Great picture and just in time for the return of Tiger and March madness. Easy to set up.

Reviews.Title: Pair Your Purchase with the Playstation 3
Reviews.Author: David Cleaver
Reviews.Content: Purchased this Sony model through Amazon on 3/8 and it was delivered 3/12.  Free white glove delivery ($60+ value)was prompt and efficient. The final comment by the delivery team was "this must be a popular tv because this is the third KDL-52W4100 delivered today", and it was only 8:15am! The picture quality is stunning.  Connected to a Playstation 3, there is almost a three dimensional viewing effect.  Even standard dvd's look exceptional upscaled through the PS3's HDMI connection.  Standalone sound quality is fine but if you have a 5.1 system hook it up and enjoy.  Finally the price, I purchased it @ $1,649.  With the $30 credit using the Amazon Visa card, net price was $1,619.  The cheapest price from BB and HHG was $1999.  Adding sales tax difference, I saved over $500!

Reviews.Title: KDL-52W4100
Reviews.Author: Michael Royston Turner
Reviews.Content: After comparing and seeing this LCD next to others at the store I am very pleased. The picture and anti-glare screen are fantastic. Sound quality is also very good.

Reviews.Title: wanted it, got it, happy with it
Reviews.Author: Mercedes Thorp
Reviews.Content: We saw this tv at sams club, and I knew right away we wanted it.The picture was the best we;ve seen,but the price was pretty high for us so we waited for a year and the price come down some.When, we were ready, we checked it out on line at different places.I asked my husband to check to see if Amazon had it and they did.This was not only the best purchase we made it was even  better for the price.The difference was such that we also purchased a blue ray and receiver. It looks beautiful on my wall and the quaility you can't beat.we get so many compliments on it .We tell everyone to check out Amazon first before they buy.It also was delivered it less than a week.We are very happy THANKS AMAZON FOR MAKING IT POSSIBLE!

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Andy "Andy R"
Reviews.Content: This TV is just awesome..  And Amazon's white glove delivery surpassed my expectations. For the past few days since I got this TV, I've tried HDMI 1.3 Blue Ray, DVD, HD channels on Dish network, even SD channels..  The video is eye popping..  I was almost sold on getting a pioneer plasma, but I am glad I made this purchase. The Sony W4100 is worth every penny I spent on it.. You could not go wrong with this TV..Cheers,Andy

Reviews.Title: Amazing Picture!
Reviews.Author: Armando Castaneda, Jr. "jr123184"
Reviews.Content: I just got one of these beauties today(3/13) after ordering it Saturday(3/7).  The price was great and the delivery service by CEVA was really good.  I set the TV up with my PS3 and a Mediabridge HDMI 1.3 cable I also got from amazon for $9.99.  After optimizing the picture with THX, the picture was just amazing.  Blurays look very detailed and dvds look pretty good.  The 120Hz precessing gets rid of ghosting and makes for a smooth image.  I highly recommend this tv to anyone looking for a great product from Sony at a very low price.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Picture and Quality
Reviews.Author: G. Mosby "GM"
Reviews.Content: I got this TV on the 2nd of March. The people from Howards TV & Appliance had it out of the box set up and running in less than 20 minutes.Pros:The picture is increditible, or "WOW". It looked as good as it did in the showroom.I have made only a few adjustments to the settings and the picture is perfect.I had heard the stories about how non HD TV looked on an HD set. I can honestly say some of them are near HD/1080 perfect. I have Verizon Fios and this may have something to do with picture quality as well.Easy to navigate around the options on the remote.With all the input ports on the tv, easy to hookup my dvd recorder, Blu-ray player and surround sound system.The picture quality with Blue-Ray is astounding.Cons:I have not found any yet.Minor, when i first turn on the set, it seems to interfere with the Verizon cable box and i can't use the remote for changing channels or to look at program info for about 3 to 5 minutes.This is a great TV and i would recomended it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV
Reviews.Author: D. Strecker
Reviews.Content: I could not be happier with this TV.  I am quite particular and find no short comings with this Sony.

Reviews.Title: Really Nice
Reviews.Author: Z
Reviews.Content: Product shipped on time, delivery took it inside the house to upstairs, unpacked and checked everything to make sure it's ok. TV is great overall.

Reviews.Title: Review of sony tv
Reviews.Author: Duane Walker "Dew"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tv after alot of research and I love it. The picture is crystal clear. Thanks sony for a great tv.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful
Reviews.Author: Phone man
Reviews.Content: The title says it all.  I've seen this LCD in stores on display, and this model always stood out among the rest. I've now had the pleasure of watching tv on this very big screen for a few weeks now and I am most satisfied.  Colors are great, 120hz refresh rate, syncs well with sony's bd550 blu ray player, one remote controls both. Blu ray is so sharp on this panel, I nearly had a tear running down my cheek the first time I watched a movie on it. Shipping was great and on time as scheduled. I have always been afraid of purchasing something this expensive online, but I am most satisfied with this purchase.  I want to  thank Amazon as well as I had an issue with the transaction and was resolved appropriately. I recommend this LCD to anyone within its budget.  It's not cheap, but it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: excellent television
Reviews.Author: D. Wollstadt
Reviews.Content: I am very satisfied with this television.  It has a great picture and the only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is it was a little hard to get it just right.  The picture is extremely adjustable through every different color (including blacks and whites).  The sound is better than any other television in the price range/size without any additional speakers.  With the surround sound it is amazing.

Reviews.Title: Sony TVand BluRay
Reviews.Author: Morris W. Pearson
Reviews.Content: Entire project was very easy.  Very good product description and pricing was very good, better by far than Sam's.  Delivery was on time.  Delivery people were prompt and courteous.  They set up the equipment and did some initial checks to see if it would power up.  Overall evaluation was excellent and I would recommend Amazon again.

Reviews.Title: Great buy.
Reviews.Author: Rodney Stuart "Colleyville.Tx"
Reviews.Content: I did lots and lots of shopping and this is what I purchased. I paid $1897.95 through Amazon.com. You will not be disappointed. I have always had great luck with Sony products.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: J. G. Mejia
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV last month to upgrade from a HD projection TV.  The picture from HD sources is awesome; it is great even from standard def programs/movies.  The sound is good enough for programs that don't need a surround system (news, cartoons, etc). The price was excellent; amazon beat the others by several hundreds of dollars; no problems with the free shipping either; I received it several days before the initial delivery date.

Reviews.Title: 1080P Man
Reviews.Author: Donald L. Davis
Reviews.Content: I made the purchase at Amazon.com because they had the best price, not to mention the free shipping and the tax break.  The TV was delivered in a satisfactory time and manner with inside delivery and setup.  I am very satisfied with the product and the convience of the Amazon.com purchasing process.

Reviews.Title: Great Tv took this over the samsung 52 model
Reviews.Author: M. Sandoval
Reviews.Content: Awesome Tv after much debate over this model and the Samsung model i finnaly decided going with the Sony model over the samsung.For the simple reason a major flaw with the samsung is that it glares extremely bad to give it greater color in blacks.While the Sony gives more of a natural charcoal color when comes to black and doesnt glare like the samsung. That and i wanted to keep every electronic in my home theater one brand. Sony Ps3, Sony LCD, Sony Floorstand Speakers.Only one Flaw  that i come up with is the remote really does need a glow or backlight.The Tv Guide feature is amazing for me a person who has cable without a cable box it helps when tv guiding. Its brings up a feature similar to a DVR without the Recording feature but it lets you view past channal times and future title times. And allows Timer Reminder Set up for your favorite shows.

Reviews.Title: Best LCD TV
Reviews.Author: Tony D. Pham "Tony"
Reviews.Content: I was debating b/w the LG and Sony but I decided to go with Sony b/c it's well known and been on the market for years.  I'm glad I picked it b/c its pictures are unsurpassed.  Very vivid, clear and high contrast.  120Hz motion flow is great.  I hooked up with my HD direct TV/ DVR and broadcasted on 1080i, my goodness the pictures are awesome.  I then hooked up to my blue-ray player and played it on 1080p and you have no idea how clear it is.  It's almost like you're there, seeing it live, rather than on TV.  It's that high-def and I'm so happy with it.  Amazon shipped it w/i a week but the TV came with the broken bevel, I called customer service and no problem, they sent out a new one the next day and I received it 3 days later.  Very happy and highly recommend Amazon and this Tv to everyone.

Reviews.Title: Sony Bravia KDL52W4100
Reviews.Author: Russell Agate "Rusty"
Reviews.Content: This HD television is all that I thought it would be. Excellent picture quality and easy navagation  with the remote control. I have a sony projection that is now fifteen years old and still working perfectly. I just wanted to switch to Hi Def while the deals were so good. My experience with Amazon went without a hitch and I was very satisfied with their service.

Reviews.Title: Love Amazon, Love the TV, Love the Service!  Amazon Rocks!
Reviews.Author: B. Betts
Reviews.Content: Man, I cannot say enough about how great Amazon is.  This TV arrived today in perfect condition with free of charge setup by Pilot Freight (a shout out to Pilot Freight-great service).  They said they'd be here by 2:00 and they were right on time.  Delivery was less than a week and earlier than Amazon said, so kudos to them!I know it must be scary to order an expensive TV from Amazon, however, fear not!  The TV is amazing, the picture is unbelievable and everything from Amazon has been perfect and beyond the call of duty!  I would not hesitate to order anything from Amazon.  What's great about Amazon is you can read reviews and decide whether you want to buy or not.  The reviews usually do not steer you wrong.  They are always right on the money.If this is your first HD TV, as it is mine, and you have had a 27" POS for 17 years, then you'll understand my complete and utter joy at having this in my home.Thanks to Amazon and thanks to Pilot Freight!

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: Steve L.
Reviews.Content: I've owned this TV for about a week now.  I am very happy with the picture and the price I paid.  The picture is very good with standard definition signals and DVD, and excellent with high definition signals.  The motionflow setting truly does work as advertised by eliminating most motion blur.  There are quite a few options in the picture settings menu so you can tweak the picture to your liking.  I didn't see any difference with a couple of them though.  Blu Ray discs look wonderfully clear and crisp, and in some cases quite stunning at 1080 24/p.  Overall I am happy I purchased this TV.  When I was shopping I wanted the best "bang for my buck" as this TV purchase was going to be my last for quite a while.  When I compared price, quality of the picture, and features, this TV won out.  I am satisfied that this TV will be my "main" TV for quite some time.

Reviews.Title: Great for watching football
Reviews.Author: Gary Clark "electric warrior"
Reviews.Content: Great for watching football.  Arrived in perfect condition and one day ahead of schedule through Amazon's contracted freight company.  A lot less money than Costco or BJ's.

Reviews.Title: Great tv - Need HD Cable
Reviews.Author: Big Red
Reviews.Content: We love this tv.  The picture is just beautiful - it looks better at our house than it did even at one of the big box stores.  I have to admit, we were a little leary based on the picture that we saw at the big box stores, but we read all of the reviews and pulled the trigger anyway.  We were not disappointed.  However, it should be made clear to everyone that to get the most out of this tv, you really need to have HD cable connected to the tv with an HDMI cable.  When we first got the tv, we did not have an HD cable box (it did not have an HDMI port), but we did within a couple of days.  The improvement was just amazing.  We had no idea that it would make that much difference.  The key to the amazing picture on this tv is hooking it up to amazing sources.  Blu-Ray looks phenomenal as well.The Amazon delivery for this item is great!  They bring it into the house, take it out of the box, and set it on your stand for you!  You would pay a lot for that service from one of the big box stores!We highly recommend buying this tv and buying it from Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Sony w4100 is the TV you want
Reviews.Author: Rick Munoz
Reviews.Content: I researched my new tv for 3-4 months.  I went to Best Buy, Cuircuit City, and a few others to see for myself, several times.  My wife was sick of it!  Just pick one, she said.  So one day we went in to Best Buy, we both saw the XBR6 and w4100 52 inch, and we actually preferred the picture and color of the w4100.  I bought it for ~ 2300, if i could go back I would buy it thru Amazon for ~1900 and save the tax, live and learn.  But here are a few of my impressions, hope they help:1)  The picture is great, I can't imagine it better.  I read a review that said the XBR had more vivid color.  When you get the w4100, under the picture menu, you can set it to vivid or cinema or standard or custom (make your own).  I like mine on vivid, the colors are amazing.  And you can really tell the diff between settings.2)  Glare really is important.  My TV sits in our living room, a skylight and reflections from the front door ruled out Samsung and Pioneer.  REALLY glad I went with Sony's matte like surface.  Yes, when the screen is completely black, you can barely notice some areas not as dark as others.  But no glare is fantastic.3)  I made my final decision irreguardless of price.  I figure I am going to be living with this tv a long time.  Narrowed it down to Pioneer plasma kuro- the picture is just not bright enough plus glare issue, and the Samsung models, all with too much glare, even with limited light.  I really wanted to buy the latest Samsung 8 0r 9 model with the backlight for the 55 inches it has, but that glare was too, much.4)  52 inches is plenty big.  I had reservations going from a 10 year old 60 in bohemoth projection tv, but after you experience true 1080p HD, you dont even notice the diff.  you just enjoy tv more.5)  GET A Sony PS3.  Blue-ray is the best (TV prof reviewers use it as the gold standard), plus you can put your photos and videos on it with ease thru a usb cable.  Friends come over and i show them the latest pictures of trips, etc, on my beautiful tv, they love it.  More features on PS3 than I thought, plus my kid loves Little Big Planet, phenomenal vid game. (don't bother with 25$ remote, the vid game controller is much easier to use, mine just sits there)6)  Mount it on the wall, if you can, it just looks better than I thought, tried it both ways.7)  I have cable tv with a few hd channels, huge diff in picture quality.8)  Anywhere you buy it, it will be shipped to the store, no one has it on hand, might as well get it from amazon shipped to you and save a bundle, (Again, no tax)9)  HD TV is phenomenal, step up, you'll love it.10)  Sound from tv is good,  good enough for my wife, definitly loud enough.  I need surround sound.7)

Reviews.Title: Awesome Picture!! Great Deal!!
Reviews.Author: L. Yee
Reviews.Content: Bought this new Sony KDL52W4100 plus a free BDPS350 blue ray player just before XMAS at Circuit City for $1748 plus $153 tax plus $10 recycle fee for a total of $1911. BB and VideoOnly wanted $500 more.Beautiful picture with minimal glare with the matte black finish screen. Samsungs have too much glare with their shiny finish. Only gripe is non-lighted remote. Using a cheap indoor antenna with great results. Dont waste $$ on pricey HDMI cable. A cheap $2.00 cable provides a beautiful picture with DVD's, did not try any BlueRay discs yet.

Reviews.Title: Sony KDL-52W4100
Reviews.Author: D. Vagnoni
Reviews.Content: This TV is great. Picture is amazing. THe people actually look real while watching Fios in HD or Blu-Ray movies. PS3 games also look amazing. Sound from the TV is great too. I highly recomend this TV. Would buy again in a heart beat. As noted by others, TV does get rather hot after watching for a time.Received the White Glove delivery from Pilot. They actually did an excellent job. Delivery was on the day scheduled (albeit they were late but it was weather related). They took the TV into the house, unpacked it, and put it on the stand for me. They also stayed around and made sure it worked (and I didn't even need to ask them to do so).

Reviews.Title: Great TV - Better with Calibration
Reviews.Author: Mohamed Ziauddin "M Ziauddin"
Reviews.Content: Pros:After recently upgrading from a worn out CRT 1080i-only TV, this is a huge improvement. After proper calibration, the blacks are very deep while retaining the bright white. The colors are also vibrant, especially on Blu-Rays and on my PS3.I use this TV for normal cable television viewing and for Blu-Rays and video games on my PS3. Through HDMI 1080p the picture is so detailed and clear compared to our last TV. The 24p playback along with 120hz give movies a much smoother feel. I know some people don't necessarily like this, but I to me it makes the TV all the better.Another thing I really liked was the fact that this TV passes 5.1 surround sound through the optical output, while some TV's downscale the 5.1 signal to a stereo signal. This allows me to have my PS3 on and at the same time get sound from cable television.Cons:The remote is a bit ugly, but its functional. I use a universal remote, so no worries there. Also the clear band of glass underneath the screen makes the TV look much better, but if you don't use the provided strap to put cables into, you can see them through the glass. The glossy exterior of the TV is a semi-dust magnet, but not as much as my PS3. Just use a micro fiber cloth and try not to leave fingerprints. There is also only one coaxial input, so if you are planning on connecting a satellite and cable connection, you must use a switcher.

Reviews.Title: Sony flat screen HDTV
Reviews.Author: Paul J. Mallon
Reviews.Content: The picture quality on this unit is amazing even without the HD programming.  Older DVD's come alive with more detail and broadcast shows have better definition.Had a problem getting the HDTV to 'automatically' detect the Blu-ray player when hooked up with the HDMI cable but it finally 'found' it after I went to one of several menus available to select input media.  Now its fine and the Sync feature (turns on the Blu-Ray and starts the DVD automatically) is working as it should.Great set, great price and well worth the investment.  Waited over 3 yrs for prices to finally come down.  Worth the wait for the Sony.

Reviews.Title: Sony 52" lcd HI-DEF
Reviews.Author: Abbas Mohsenine "abe  miami"
Reviews.Content: One of the best tv,s I have ever bought. Smooth picture and brilliant colors and same angle view as front view. Speakers are a bit weak if you do not have surrond sound attached. I would buy this Tv again If I have to without thinking about it for a second. Must have Tv for anybody who likes the best pictuers and quality.

Reviews.Title: Kudos to Amazon!
Reviews.Author: B. Henegar
Reviews.Content: I ordered the Sony KDL-52W4100 on a Monday. it was delivered Thursday afternoon - and I paid $0 shipping - as well as $0 sales tax - over a $200 savings combined. Amazon's price was the same as the big box retailers in my area. But, in addition to the sales tax issue, neither of the local outlets had the TV in stock. That meant waiting on shipment anyway - and they wanted to charge me a shipping/delivery fee.As for quality, I buy Sony for a reason. This TV doesn't disappoint me at all. The picture is spectacular! I have it connected to a DirecTV HD receiver, but am currently only receiving my local channels in HD. The HD channels are brilliant - but even the non-HD satellite channels are incredible.I found the TV easy to set up. The onscreen menus were easy to follow. I haven't begun to dig into the more advanced features - I'm still enjoying the amazing quality of Sony combined with HDTV. I bought this model mainly for the 120HZ Motionflow technology. I turned it on during setup - and haven't yet turned the feature off to compare the difference between 120HZ and 60HZ.If you want quality, buy Sony. If you want to be amazed, buy the KDL-52W4100. If you want a good deal, buy from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Sony Bravia 52"
Reviews.Author: T. Russell
Reviews.Content: Wow! We love the TV. The menus are a little tricky at first (reading the manual helped!) but otherwise we couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: C. Teague
Reviews.Content: I love this TV, it's huge and the picture is beautiful. Great Sony quality. We don't buy anything else anymore.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful picture, beautiful price
Reviews.Author: Roger Musa
Reviews.Content: This Sony television, in my opinion, has all of the highest qualities that I was looking for in an LCD TV. I have noticed the greatness of the 120 Mhz motionflow in comparison to the 60 Mhz televisions, especially when playing an action movie or an action game on PS 3.This thing has 4 HDMI inputs as well. LCD backlighting was not really a big selling point for me and frankly I don't think it justifies the price increase.Overall, I'm very happy with this beautiful picture.

Reviews.Title: KDL52W4100 review
Reviews.Author: Michael Dileva
Reviews.Content: This 52" W4100 series set is almost as good as the XBR series and costs significantly less.  It plays well out of the box with many improved features over the previous 3000 series.Viewing angle, brightness, audio and compatibility with Sony Blu Ray are great.  HDMI audio/Video with the 120 Hz motion smoothing is outstanding.Truly a great buy for anyone

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: R S "Rick"
Reviews.Content: Received mine yesterday, was to be delivered by 12/9 but came the next day. Very easy to hook up.  Great picture and sound, everything it was advertised.  Got a great price with free shipment.  The only thing I made a mistake on was thinking that it had white glove delivery, my mistake since amazon only has white glove delivery on the products they sell and not from a 3rd party.  Again, my mistake for not reading all of the description.  I am very pleaesed with the purchase.  Sony Bravia W-Series KDL-52W4100 52-Inch 1080p 120Hz LCD HDTV

Reviews.Title: excellent television, with great delivery
Reviews.Author: M. Zehngut
Reviews.Content: This set is fantastic.  Excellent picture and sound.  I have had very good luck with Sony TVs, having had an old 19" set last for well over 20 years.  This set is very easy to set up and use, and has an excellent picture.  I shopped for months and decided on Sony over Samsung mainly due to the matte screen vs. Samsung's glossy, reflective screen.  Delivery was not "white-glove", but was one delivery person who helped me lift the set onto a stand and removed all packing materials, which was fine for my needs.  I highly recommend this set.  Amazon's delivered price was excellent as well.

Reviews.Title: Best TV I Ever Purchased
Reviews.Author: P. Crawford
Reviews.Content: Arrived sooner than expected and in perfect condition.  Delivery Man did not unpack and remove packaging...partially my fault as I didn't know it was included in the delivery.  The TV is Great...picture is amazing, features are very user friendly.Price dropped by $85 within a week of purchase...wondering if Amazon has a 30 day price guarantee?

Reviews.Title: Amazon Customer service absolutely first rate 100% tops!!!
Reviews.Author: Gawken
Reviews.Content: I ordered the Sony 2 weeks ago, after doing some research, in part because of Amazon's great price, and the reviews I read here. I admit, I was a tad nervous about ordering a big-ticket item from an online retailer, having never done it before. The set arrived exactly when scheduled, the afternoon of the 11th. The guy from my cable company came the next morning, the 12th, to hook it up. We take it out of the box, put it on the stand. He connects it, turns it on..we have sound, but NO picture. So we call Sony..they say try a few things..( thank God the cable guy is here) no luck..NO pic..nada..zilch...so Sony gives me an Event #..( sounds like a FEMA event) and the number for one of their authorized repair outfits..I call, and the guy arrives the NEXT day, the 13th, on time, exactly when scheduled.a miracle..We lay the set face down on a blanket, he takes it apart..tests a bunch of stuff..he thought there might have been a loose connection..no joy..he calls Sony, on his tech support line..they go through more options..finally decide that the whole panel, AND possibly one or two boards, are kaput, and have to be replaced. It will take a week or so to get them, and then they have to turn my living room into a TV repair shop. At this point I say to myself..NO WAY..not gonna happen..so I call Amazon..just start to tell my story to the lady who gets my call...after one minute, she says "SIR, STOP!!! I'm so sorry that happened to you.. We'll send you out a new set today, and the people who deliver it weill pick up the old one at the same time.." I am stunned. NO WAY it can be this easy. Truly a great way to do business. BTW...talking tot he repair guy and the Sony tech, it seems like it's unheard of for a set to be bad right out of the box...neither of them new of it ever happening before. All I can say, if I had boufght it from Best Buy or Circuit City, no way would they have been as eager to send me a new one..so, for me..I'm 100% sold on Amazon...however..I'm gonna miss all the footballgames theis coming weekend on my big new set...

Reviews.Title: Sony Bravada 52 inch LCD T
Reviews.Author: Timothy Maher
Reviews.Content: The TV is fantastic!!  Great picture and sound!!  I cannot thank Amazon enough for this product, the price was the best I have ever found and the shipping was excellent!  Ordered the TV on a Monday, it came that Friday! Thanks Amazon!!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Timothy Butler
Reviews.Content: Did a lot of research on LCD tvs and actually purchased a much larger type.  Our son talked us into returning it and purchasing this Sony for the 120 hz and we're glad we did.  Picture is fantastic.  No complaints.  Amazon delivery was perfect as well.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Damian G. Karlo
Reviews.Content: I was a little leery to purchase such an expensive and delicate item over the internet and have it delivered to my home. I have to say that I can't be more pleased with my purchase. The television arrived quickly and in perfect condition via Amazon's "white glove" delivery, and I have been enjoying my favorite programs in HD ever since!

Reviews.Title: great tv great delivery time
Reviews.Author: jaj "jerry"
Reviews.Content: ordered the sony kdl-52w4100 on friday and received it the next wednesday - delivered and brought into the house and set on the stand.  (Also ordered some Blue ray movies at the same time - it's saturday and they're still not here - went by smail mail.)  After ordering, there was a difficulty in getting the Amazon credit card to clear the purchase but was cleared up in a short time.  Amazon responded to my communications very quickly. The cabinet is nice looking  and when the hdmi cables are threaded correctly, no wires are visible even through the clear cavity built into the lower part of the set.  That design is actually rather neat looking.  The sound is good for tv only sound.  I have a sound system hooked up and it is very good.  I chose the sony not only because of their reputation but also I think they stand behind their product better than Samsung and some other brands.  So far I am very pleased.

I waited for the 52XBR6 to come out to compare, but I think the picture is better on this one. Seems brighter, better view from angles (and whiter), and much cheaper. The XBR screen seemed a bit more shiny also. The w4100 screen is a little more shiny that some cheaper models but much less than the high end Samsungs and the Plasmas. For now close to 2K this is a great deal.The flowmotion 120HZ is worth the extra money. Works well especially for TV and sports. I like it on the mid setting for movies, but my son likes it off? So that is a personal preference.Only slight negative is maybe the stand does not seem that sturdy.. I wonder how the TV would hold up in an earthquake?Now at least I can stay home and see some great TV, sports, and movies on my 52" SONY LCD...  **** the economy.

Reviews.Title: In time for the digital tv switch, and way to go Amazon!
Reviews.Author: LawyerMom
Reviews.Content: My parents have been looking to replace their 20 year old big screen television for awhile now and took advantage of my being around for the holidays to purchase the Sony Bravia W-series 52 inch lcd tv so that, lucky me, I could set it up for them.  I will mention that this TV is being used solely for free, over the air digital broadcasting and not for cable or satellite TV, so I will review it as such.First, Amazon was, well, amazing.  We purchased the TV on the Friday afternoon after Christmas, told it would arrive between Jan 6 - 15, but actually received it on New Year's eve, less than 3 full business days after ordering it!  Amazon's delivery contractor was excellent, their tracking system was on top of the order from beginning to end, and they had two guys bring in the television and help set it up on our tv stand.  Score.  After getting a good look at the size of this TV (it's like the size of 2.5 of me!), it is not the sort of thing you would want to load into your car and try to bring home on your own.  This is not even to mention that Amazon's price was at least $300 below the local big electronics retailer (that's not even including the tax I would have had to pay).Set up was brilliantly simple (which is good, b/c I'm a moron when it comes to electronics).  My parents don't speak English, so I was pleased to see that once setup was complete, the TV pretty much worked itself.  I set the TV up with the new Sony bluray player we got using an HDMI cable (Amazon's prices, again, the best for those cables); hooked up our very old vcr with the old analog (3 pronged, red, yellow, and white) cable; hooked up the old rabbit-ear antenna (relieved I didn't need to buy a new one); plugged all these pieces into a surge protector and ta-da! It worked!  I also love love love how the TV instantly detects the external components, so you can put in a videotape, DVD, or bluray disc and push play, and the TV will automatically go to your external device.  (This is good, again, for the electronically challenged among us.)  I should add that there are 4 HDMI outlets on this TV, a PC outlet, and room for at least 4 analog components.Lots of features on this guy:  auto-sensor for ambient light; excellent speakers; Bravia sync which synchronized the TV to our bluray player so they turned on/off in unison; free TV guide programming; power saving options; etc. etc. etc.  Unlike another reviewer, I actually really like the remote control.  It's incredibly user-friendly.  The only thing I would change is that the home button and circular trackpad be moved to the bottom and the channel & volume buttons be moved to the middle.The picture is good.  I think, though, that I was expecting a lot better.  There is still some evidence (or more evidence than I'd prefer) of pixelation despite all the fanfare regarding the 120Hz and digital signal.  Potential buyers should take care in picking the appropriate sized TV for their room, as this will only emphasize the pixelation if you get a TV too large for your space.I don't know if this is something that will get ironed out in the future, but the letterboxing (i.e. the black bars on the sides or on top & bottom of the program being viewed) is kinda annoying.  You can switch from channel to channel or even (when on the same channel) from program to program and you'll see different variations on the letter boxing.  I was watching the local news which had no letter-boxing, then they'd run a commercial that had letterboxing on the sides of the screen, then the next commercial would have letterboxing on both sides AND on the top and bottom of the screen, etc. etc.  Sony made it easier to deal with this with the simple touch of the "Wide" button on the remote, but you have to adjust it with every single program and/or channel.  It would be nice if there were some way that this was fixed universally or if Sony could have automatically adjusted the picture to the perfect zoom.  (Sigh, maybe I ask too much.)  As I said, perhaps this will be ironed out once the networks adjust to only digital signals.Very happy with the purchase and I think you definitely get your money's value with this tv.

Reviews.Title: So upsetting
Reviews.Author: Matthew Yates
Reviews.Content: I bought my tv on April 19th last month.  The picture was beautiful for four days, then these lines appeared and would not go away. In the menu, there is a customer support number, I figured I would need to just reset the tv to make the lines go away. The lady walked me through it and nothing happened.  She said a service technician would have to come out and look at it. The service guy came out the next day and determined the panel was bad and needed to be replaced. I contacted the store I bought it at and they informed me they do not have any and wont be receiving any more of the 52w4100's.  They offered me a store credit, but I would still have to come up with $600 to get the xbr.  My friend works at a service center and he reassured me that it would be like brand new if they changed the panel. I felt comfortable about having it changed. It took another two weeks for the service man to get the parts in and an available service time for him to come fix it.  He arrived, changed the parts and nothing happened. Sony sent bad parts. Before, there were lines in the tv, but it could still be watched. Now, I cant even watch it.  He called sony right away and they told him they would call me in two days to inform me of the exchange policy.  Two days later they called and first offered to upgrade me for $400 to a tv that is $200 less than mine on their own site.  Then they told me they could only send me a refurbished one, that they didnt have any new ones and it will take 19 days for it to get to me.  That was very upsetting. I called customer service back and asked them why it would take so long and that they have new ones in stock on their site that ship the next day. The picture was beautiful for 4 days. If I could do it again, would buy a samsung.

Reviews.Title: Defective upon receipt
Reviews.Author: Timothy D. Williams "T Williams"
Reviews.Content: This TV arrived defective upon receipt.  The box looked flawless, but it was dropped or something went wrong somewhere.  The screen would blink in and out.  Audio generally worked, but would not occassionally.  Contacted Sony hotline.  Did some gymnastics and convinced them the TV was set up correctly.  Got permission to use local service company for warranty work.  Needs new LCD panel and board.  Parts out of stock.  This is the 5th week and no TV yet.  I hope this is extremely unusual as I have had good luck with Sony in the past.UPDATE:  1 part arrived when promised.  2nd still on back order.  Called Sony.  They elevated the case and offered a new TV in replacement.  I said fine.  10 more days and the new TV arrived.  In total it was 6/7 weeks.  New TV is working great.I could have returned the damaged TV to the vendor, but they charge freight even for damaged returns on TV's over 27".  Would have been faster, but I didn't see why I should pay any additional costs.I am happy with the new TV.  My rating reflects the repair experience with Sony.

Reviews.Title: INITIAL REVIEW AFTER 5 DAYS OWNERSHIP...SONY BRAVIA W SERIES 52 INCH
Reviews.Author: James Karam "Jim...car nut"
Reviews.Content: Thought I would give our first impressions of this 52 inch Sony LCD.  The White Glove delivery through Amazon was very good.  We elected to keep all the packing and box just in case the set had an issue.  So far, no problems.  The set came with the stand already assembled.We had previously prepped the wall over the fireplace to mount this unit.  We did, by the way, purchase a Cheetah Mount for $35.00 and change with $10.00 shipping.  Those in store (Circuit City, Best Buy, ABC mounts for $200 + dollars are just way to expensive (read this overpriced!) in my book.  We were very impressed with the construction and design of this wall mount which is rated up to 180 lbs.  This new set comes in at 71 lbs.DO purchase your cable connections as well as wall mounts through the internet.  Just a ton of money to save and very quick delivery.  E.G. 2 HDMI gold tipped 10 foot cables for $3.99! + shipping.But, I digress.  We came from a 46 inch Analog rear projection Hitachi.  Purchased it brand new in 1997 and spent, cough...$2,200!!  That set has performed flawlessly and is presently in our sons and his familys great room.  This state of the art flat screen just jumps at you, almost 3d ish.  Im sure you folks out there who have migrated to this flat screen technolosy in the last few years would not be as impressed as we are (going from an LCD from 3 years ago to this unit today).I did a lot of research on these flat screens and had narrowed it to the SAMSUNG equivalent and this unit.  The reviews for this unit on the AMAZON web set were very helpful and is one of the reasons I wanted to post our impressions.  We lucked out on the money saved by watching for promotional codes in electronics on AMAZONs site.  Our total cost for this set, with NO shipping or sales tax, was $1,599.99!A site we found very helpful had to do with CALIBRATION of this set by users like you and I.  Here it is[...]Be sure to read through this whole calibration topic as other users have provided their settings.  To some degree this is subjective as the sets environment will affect your ultimate viewing pleasure.After letting our set run with its factory default settings for the last 5 days, I felt that I needed to tweak the blacks on our set.  My son thought that the blacks (night scenes) lacked definition.  So, I adjusted the settings to mirror what OFF_ONLINE posted at the above web site.  The only change to his settings I made was to increase the backlight from 50 to 70.  Im leaving these settings in place for a while to see how the set reacts to daylight running and in 480i mode as well.We DO like the matte finish of the screen.  The set is mounted in an unlit area over the mantle that faces out towards a row of 3 sets of windowed french doors.  As you can imagine there is a lot of natural light that flows directly at this set.  That matte finish just mutes the glare.  A big plus for this set.All in all, this 1st impression of 5 days ownership, is a big PLUS!Jim & Mary

Bottom line, our TV has still not been repaired.  Parts have taken weeks to arrive.  At first, they thought it was the video processing board. The system dumps you to an answering machine, but no one ever calls back.  I escalated to Sony directly, begging them to simply relace the TV, but to no avail.This is, by far, the worst experience I have ever had with a product or their service departments.  Do not buy this TV or any other Sony product.  I'm also not sure it was worth the savings to buy from Amazon.  I can't believe that Best Buy would do this to their customers.

Reviews.Title: Great product by sony
Reviews.Author: Eng Saar Bibla
Reviews.Content: I'd start with why I gave only 4 star. Well, the product was supposed to arrive on the 8th, but it arrived the day after. When there's no other TV at home, it makes a diffrence.The TV itself has great picture. I find that you have to readjust the picture, as it is set for a store with lots of light, where at home usually this is not the case. So either use vivid, or use custom.Sound is brilliant, and the menus are quite easy to get the hangon.

Reviews.Title: Bait and switch
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Been a dedicated Amazon shopper for years, now until.....Ordered this set and Blue Ray package, on the web site for a good price, thought was a fair amount, not a crazy deal like a software malfunction that dropped the price of the TV dramatically.Got an e-mail next morning stating that they canceled the order due to "incorrect pricing" of the TV, so I canceled the entire order.If AMAZON PERSONEL are reviewing this/these opinions; FYI canceling a large order just for a few extra bucks and pissing off a dedicated shopper, in this economic environment, is a dumb thing to do.

Reviews.Title: noise from inside of this new tv kdl-52w4100.
Reviews.Author: Steve Tong "snowy"
Reviews.Content: Bought this new tv kdl-52w4100 last Dec.Popping noise come most likely from the heat causing plastic structure contraction. Has Sony's svc came by different techenicians twice so far. First one opened the back cover and put it back, he said it should work. But, if it does not, then no way to fix it. It did not work. So, called another svc guy. He showed up and adjust the "picture" to lighter brightness. He said that way won't consume too much electricity and less heat will be generated which will help. It did not help.This popping noise is so annoying when you are concentrating to watch program.Is anyone experiencing this problem. Otherwise, it's a very good tv.

Reviews.Content: This TV is promoted as on sale.  Thats not the case.  You can buy cheaper elsewhere.  Why are internet vendors doing this? TImes are hard and they try to spoof a fake discount.Bah Hum bug

Reviews.Title: Good TV, Terrible Customer Service from Sony
Reviews.Author: Craig Dickson "Independent Software Consultant"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV through Amazon.comDuring the process of setting up the television at my house the tiny strap on the back of the table-top stand that is meant to be used for bundling up all of the cables fell apart in my hand when I tried to unsnap it for the first time. It is a tiny piece of plastic about the size of a large rubber band. Clearly this part is fragile at best, but it came apart into 3 separate pieces when I first touched it. It was clearly defective.I contacted Sony customer service on their "Customer Service" hotline (1-239-768-7547) and after being on the phone for over 30 minutes I was told that Sony would not replace the part, but I could have the privilege of paying $2.25 for the part and another $6 for shipping via UPS.They even had the audacity to try and blame the white-glove shipping company that Amazon.com used for breaking the part.So if you are counting that's $8.25 for a tiny piece of plastic (which probably cost 10c to manufacture), that was defective when I received it, on a television worth over $1,800 when I bought it.Poor form Sony, you just lost a customer who owns 2 previous Televisions, a Camcorder and a DVD player of yours.So my recommendation is to not purchase anything from Sony unless you are OK receiving this kind of customer service.

Reviews.Title: Who Pays for Amazon's Pricing Mistake...the Customer of Course!
Reviews.Author: Steelers Fan
Reviews.Content: I have always been pleased with my shopping experiences at Amazon until today.  Yesterday, I purchased this television at what I thought was a good price, considering it will soon be replaced by a newer model.  This morning I received an e-mail (see contents below) indicating that my order has been cancelled due to an incorrect price.  I had an order confirmation for a price of $1431.20.  The currently posted price is now $1649.98.  That's over $215 difference.  Needless to say, I called customer service and ended up talking to the clueless, brainless robot Izhe C.  All she did was recite the contents of the e-mail, and even after admitting Amazon made a mistake, said there was nothing she could do about it.  She went so far as to mute the phone and not even listen to what I had to say.  Normally, you pay when you make a mistake, but not when you're Amazon.  They think it's a great way to cover their a** by cancelling orders and making the customer pay for their alledged pricing mistakes.  I wonder what would have happened if I ordered the TV, then called the next day and said "I made a mistake, I don't have as much money in my bank account as I thought".  Would they allow me to cancel my order with no penalty?  If this is the way they choose to treat their customers, then not only have they cancelled this order, but any future orders from me as well.E-Mail Contents===============Greetings from Amazon.com.We regret to inform you that an error caused the following item(s) tobe displayed at an incorrect price:Sony Bravia W-Series KDL-52W4100 52-Inch 1080p 120Hz LCD HDTVIn accordance with our posted policies on pricing, we are unable to offer this item for the incorrectly posted price. Therefore, we have cancelled your order for this item.At any given time, despite our best efforts, a small number of the millions of items on our site may be mispriced. We do, however, verify prices as part of our shipping procedures. If we discover that an item's correct price is higher than our stated price, we will, at our discretion, either contact you for instructions before shipping or cancel your order and notify you of such cancellation. This policy is posted in the Help section and is accessible through numerous other areas of our web site.We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause.We value your business and hope that you will give us a chance to serve you again in the future.Sincerely,Customer Service DepartmentAmazon.comPlease note: this e-mail was sent from a notification-only address that cannot accept incoming e-mail. Please do not reply to this message.

Reviews.Title: Another Victim

Reviews.Content: I'm not going to repeat what the others have said. I will only say that it has been confirmed that a few people actually received the TV at that $1461 price. That is what makes me upset the most. I don't understand why my money is any different.

Reviews.Title: what a joke
Reviews.Author: E. Preston
Reviews.Content: We ordered this product from Amazon after some careful online shopping for what seemed like a comparable deal to other offers.  Authorization was put on our credit card and we were looking forward to our new TV!  Only we were told told a day and a half later that the product was not available for the price advertised by Amazon (i.e. they didn't want to sell it for such a low price afterall....)  The order was removed from our account, but the hold put on our credit card remained for days afterwards.  Amazon shouldn't be able to retract an offer like this - in the time it took for us to order the tv and be told it wasn't available we missed out on the same deal online elsewhere.  Very disappointed.

Reviews.Content: Same ISSUE with Amazon - ordered for $1431 and the next day got a cancellation email...to top it off - I know for certain the same TV was shipped to other customers - a credit (ranging from $20-30 towards next purchase) was offered to other customers for this trouble - when I asked for the same credit - was denied...in addition to that Amazon still has to reverse charges on credit card

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware!
Reviews.Author: James V. Eulo
Reviews.Content: I wrote a previous One Star review which never appeared regarding my attempt to purchase the Sony 52 inch W Series HDTV.  I ordered the TV at $1431.00, gave my credit card information and received a purchase confirmation and expected date of delivery.  The very next day, like others, I received an email advising me that they had canceled my order, and referring me to their Policy section.  Now I've noticed that this very same HDTV price remains stuck at the same price of $1649.00 without changing from day to day like it did before.  I find that peculiar.  Needless to say, I am extremely unhappy with Amazon.com and the way they've handled this so called error.  BUYER'S BEWARE!

Reviews.Title: Bad Business

Reviews.Content: Waited a long time to get a good lcd tv. When I saw the Amazon price for the Sony kdl-52w4100 120hz lcd I jumped on it. I received a confirmation email and shipment date right away! Next morning an apology from Amazon : NO CAN DO!! I believe once I got the confirmation email with the price and delivery date, they should have kept their word!!

Reviews.Title: The Heat is On!
Reviews.Author: Dr. BT
Reviews.Content: Excellent picture quality 5/5 stars...makes most Blu-Ray movies look like it was recorded from digital camcorder.  Games on my PS3 or XBox360 looks fantastic. Here's the big but...Within an hr the tv is on...room starts getting hot.  Its a noticeable source for heat...like a little furnace.  On top of the TV gets real hot with heat blowing out of it and the whole tv feels hot...so if you're putting this in a non-circulatory entertainment room you will feel it.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding!
Reviews.Author: Stephen Millsap
Reviews.Content: I wanted to find a LCD that met my expectations.  This new Sony with the 120HZ is fantastic.Great TV overall.  No problems at all.

Reviews.Title: Amazon Sucks!
Reviews.Author: John Young
Reviews.Content: I ordered this TV from Amazon and canceled my previous order from another vendor, the next day I received an email the next telling me that Amazon has canceled my order. Now my other order is gone because the sale was over. This is not the first time Amazon did that to me. Buyer, beware!

Reviews.Title: Do not see what all the hype is about.
Reviews.Author: T. Jones "The Tool Man"
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV about a week ago.  I have a seven year old RCA tube TV that has as good of a picture as this one.  It's all right, I guess, but with all the ravings about this TV, I thought I was really getting something.  Maybe it's because I don't have high def...?  For over the air analog broadcasts the picture is actually worse.  Yes, I know we'll not have those in a few more months.  The digital picture seems "jerky" to me and the remote must have been designed by someone that never uses a remote.  The volume and channel buttons are at the very bottom of the remote instead of being in the middle.  It's not comfortable to use since the remote is not balanced in your hand.  Also it ONLY controls the TV.  You'd have thought with a $3000 TV, they'd supply a universal remote... sorry.  If you have satellite, you will have to use your satellite remote to turn on the satellite box and change channels and your TV remote to use the TV.  It's like going back in time.  If you have high def. cable, you'll have to use your high def. cable remote to control your cable box and the TV remote for the TV.  I did get the satellite remote programmed to work some parts of the TV, such as volume, channels and input, but that's all it will do and you must still keep the TV remote to do anything else.  I thought maybe I was not seeing how to program the remote for other devices so I checked with Sony and they said that I was correct that the remote only works the TV.  I'd give it another star if the remote was decent.  Too bad Sony, you dropped the ball on this one.

Reviews.Title: RUN AWAY RUN AWAY
Reviews.Author: Donald Keylon "Captain"
Reviews.Content: What a total farce, Blu ray beats HD.... HDMI Cables?? Compatibility???$4500 dollars for NOTHING!! OK so I bought into the hype that Blu ray won the HD Race. I buy into the interoperability of SONY and THE hollywood ONLY serving HDMI Cable... I buy a new $3500 TV (Sony 1080P/24-52") and a new Sony Blue Ray Player and a new BLUE RAY FILMED MOVIE for three TIMES the price of a standard DVD and put them together only to discover that I have black lines (letterbox) on my TV, The picture is a little worse than a standard DVD, the menu system works like a $27 VCR. The "Interoperability" between the Sony TV and the SONY BD works about like free air digital TV. And the Audio is like listening to a 3 transistor radio...What a total JOKE!! ANYONE CONSIDERING UPGRADING TO ALL THE "NEWEST" because of ALL THE HYPE, Leave your money in your pocket. Go buy a cheeseburger and put the remainder in a 401k. When what you have breaks, get new average price stuff. When you pay all the big bucks for all the best you get NOTHING NOTHING NOTHING!Maybe someone else's BD/TV actually works (oh wait a minute, ALL BD is Based on SONY technology....)Sony (who made my PSP, PS3, Nav System, TVx5, BD Player and PDA has seen the last of my credit card.MY NEW $500 BD Player hooked up to my new $3500 52" LCD TV, wants to operate in PAN-N-Scan mode in order to utilize the other 30% of the $100 per square inch real estate I bought from sony.I though Pan-N-Scan died with Beta Max....In closing, you would get the exact same experience (Maybe better with a $27 480i DVD Player, a $99 "Home theater system" and a No Name Rear Projection 50" DONT BUY DONT BUY DONT BUY
